canonical_description: A beautiful princess who flees into the forest to escape her wicked stepmother, the evil queen, in the Snow White fairy tale.
rationale: Both refer to the same individual character; one simply describes her royal role as a beautiful princess.

canonical_description: The sibling pair Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm, German scholars and folklorists who collected and published classic European folk and fairy tales such as "Hansel and Gretel" in the early 19th century.
rationale: Both entries refer to the same pair of German folklorists, differing only in role emphasis (general scholars vs. collectors of 'Hansel and Gretel').

canonical_description: Traditional beliefs, stories, and customs shared within a culture that influence or shape the origins and transmission of fairytales.
rationale: Both entities share the same name, very similar descriptions, and refer to the general concept of folklore in the context of fairytales.
